intro: Marcgravia comosa, commonly known as the velvety mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Marcgraviaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves that are often covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its berries are usually red or orange, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. Marcgravia comosa is often found growing on the branches of trees in humid, shaded environments.
